explanation:
code_hardening: Added a guard to ensure the input digit is within 0–9 and return early otherwise; included optional commented debug output for ignored inputs.
resolve_compilation_errors: Fully qualified all key codes with java.awt.event.KeyEvent.VK_NUMPADx and relied on the existing doType(...) method assumed available from the superclass.
exception_handling: Removed any exception paths; the method performs no action for invalid inputs and does not throw or catch exceptions.
logic_customization: Changed to a digit-based helper that maps only digits 0–9 to their corresponding numpad key codes via doType; removed all handling of letters, symbols, whitespace, and shift-modified keys.
refactoring: Renamed and implemented the method as a private numpad-specific helper with a minimal switch and clear intent; eliminated unused/non-numpad logic.
misc: Added a brief comment documenting numpad-only behavior and kept formatting simple; no new custom API calls beyond KeyEvent constants.
